definition: thorough and detailed/exhaustive/the tedious details in full
what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
to explain in detail/detailed answer/full solution (to a math problem)
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details

sentences.english: The scholarship and research grants distribution is as appendix table 1.
sentences.chinese: 獎學金和獎教金具體分佈詳請見附件1。

sentences.english: North entrance to the embedded Taming stone, quite detailed records.
sentences.chinese: 門外北向嵌有塔銘刻石，記載頗詳。

sentences.english: You said you work for Freedom and Fashion. Could you tell us about it in detail?
sentences.chinese: 你說你在“自由與時尚”工作。能跟我們詳細說說嗎？

sentences.english: The lucky clouds, also used on the Beijing Olympic torch, signify auspiciousness in Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 詳雲也採用了奧運火炬圖形，標誌着中華祥和的文化。

sentences.english: Please tell how do you use the toaster in details?
sentences.chinese: 詳細說一下你是怎樣使用多士爐的？

sentences.english: We will pay close attention to how comparative historical case studies are conducted.
sentences.chinese: 我們將會詳加註意如何進行比較性歷史個案研究。

sentences.english: We discussed that topic at length at our meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我們在詳會上細地討論了這個話題。

sentences.english: The management of the Fund and the investment style adopted are set out and explained in the HKMA's annual report.
sentences.chinese: 外匯基金的管理和投資方式詳載於金管局年報。

sentences.english: Movements in Designated Funds of the Association are shown in Note 16 to the financial statements.
sentences.chinese: 本會各項特定基金之變動詳列於財務報表附註16內。

sentences.english: Say more about the TV show you just mentioned.
sentences.chinese: 詳細點說說你剛纔提到的電視節目。

sentences.english: A small village amid verdant fields appears quiet and calm.
sentences.chinese: 綠野平疇中有幾幢紅頂小屋，顯得寧靜詳和。

sentences.english: The mechanism of these phenomena can best be explained in terms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 這些現象的機械學用能源的術語最能道盡其詳。

definition: to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
to do textual research/to make textual criticism/to verify by means of research (esp. historical details)/to take an exam to get a certificate (abbr. for 考取證件|考取证件[kao3 qu3 zheng4 jian4])
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
